intro: Lichtensteinia runcinata, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and are often used in traditional medicine. Lichtensteinia runcinata is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
